intro: Sonchus intermedius, commonly known as common sowthistle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster, blooming from summer to autumn. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
